Interface BodyAdapter.Decoder

All Superinterfaces:
BodyAdapter
All Known Implementing Classes:

Enclosing interface:

public static interface BodyAdapter.Decoder extends BodyAdapter
BodyAdapter specialization for converting response bodies into objects.
See Also:
T vs Supplier<T>

  • Method Details

    • toObject

      <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> toObject​(TypeRef<T> type, @Nullable MediaType mediaType)
      Returns a BodySubscriber that decodes the response body into an object of the given type using the format specified by the given media type. If mediaType is null, the decoders's default format settings will be used.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type represent by type
      Parameters:
      type - the object type
      mediaType - the media type

    • toDeferredObject

      default <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<Supplier<T>> toDeferredObject​(TypeRef<T> type, @Nullable MediaType mediaType)
      Returns a completed BodySubscriber that lazily decodes the response body into an object of the given type using the format specified by the given media type. If mediaType is null, the decoder's default format settings will be used.

      The default implementation returns a subscriber completed with a supplier that blocks (uninterruptedly) on the subscriber returned by toObject(TypeRef, MediaType). Any completion exception raised while blocking is rethrown from the supplier as a CompletionException. Encoders that support reading from a blocking source should override this method to defer reading from such a source until the supplier is called.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type represent by type
      Parameters:
      type - the object type
      mediaType - the media type

    • installed

      static List<BodyAdapter.Decoder> installed()
      Returns an immutable list containing the installed decoders.

    • getDecoder

      static Optional<BodyAdapter.Decoder> getDecoder​(TypeRef<?> type, @Nullable MediaType mediaType)
      Returns an Optional containing a Decoder that supports the given object type and media type. If mediaType is null, any decoder supporting the given type will be returned.
      Parameters:
      type - the object type
      mediaType - an optional media type defining the deserialization format
